Components¶

Components of vaillant system

Component¶

class pymultimatic.model.component.Component(id: str, name: Optional[str], time_program: pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimeProgram, current_temperature: Optional[float], target_temperature: Optional[float], operating_mode: pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode, quick_veto: Optional[pymultimatic.model.mode.QuickVeto])¶

This is a common class for components in the system. A component can be Room, Zone, HotWater or Circulation.

It allows you to get the ActiveMode.

Note

active_mode should not be used directly through the component, actually, the component is only aware of itself, so in case of a QuickMode is running on, you may not receive the active mode that is really applied. You should use System for that.

Parameters

  • id (str) – Id of the component, this is used to get data from the API.

  • name (str) – Name of the component, this is set by the user through the mobile app or via the VRC700.

  • time_program (TimeProgram) – Used for time based operating mode, AUTO

  • current_temperature (float) – Current temperature for the component, this is None for Circulation

  • target_temperature (float) – Temperature the component is trying to reach, also None for Circulation

  • operating_mode (OperatingMode) – Configured operating mode.

  • quick_veto (QuickVeto) – Will be populated if there is a QuickVeto running on. Always None for Circulation and HotWater.

property active_mode¶

Get the ActiveMode for this component. All operating modes and quick veto are handled, but not quick mode.

Note: Component.active_mode should not be used directly through the component, actually, the component is only aware of itself, so in case of a QuickMode is running on, you may not receive the active mode that is really applied. You should use System for that.

Type

ActiveMode

Circulation¶

class pymultimatic.model.component.Circulation(id: str, name: Optional[str], time_program: pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimeProgram, operating_mode: pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode)¶

This is representing the circulation from the system. This is a bit special component since there is no current_temperature, target_temperature nor quick_veto.

MODES = [OperatingMode(name='ON'), OperatingMode(name='OFF'), OperatingMode(name='AUTO')]¶

List of mode that are applicable to the circulation component.

Hot Water¶

class pymultimatic.model.component.HotWater(id: str, name: Optional[str], time_program: pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimeProgram, current_temperature: Optional[float], target_temperature: Optional[float], operating_mode: pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode)¶

This is representing the hot water from the system.

There is no quick_veto available for this component.

MAX_TARGET_TEMP = 70¶

Max target temperature for the hot water.

MIN_TARGET_TEMP = 35¶

Min target temperature for the hot water.

MODES = [OperatingMode(name='ON'), OperatingMode(name='OFF'), OperatingMode(name='AUTO')]¶

List of mode that are applicable to the hot water component.

Room¶

class pymultimatic.model.component.Room(id: str, name: Optional[str], time_program: pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimeProgram, current_temperature: Optional[float], target_temperature: Optional[float], operating_mode: pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode, quick_veto: Optional[pymultimatic.model.mode.QuickVeto], child_lock: bool, window_open: bool, devices: List[pymultimatic.model.component.Device], humidity: Optional[float] = None)¶

This is representing a room from the system.

Note

The boost function - the boost function is activated by pressing the temperature selector. This means that the heating valves on the assigned radiator thermostats are immediately opened 80% for 5 minutes - is not reflected into the API.

Parameters

  • child_lock (bool) – Indicate if the device is locked, meaning you cannot use the buttons on the device.

  • window_open (bool) – Indicate if a window is open in the room. Of course, this is data interpretation from vaillant API.

  • devices (List[Device]) – List of Device inside the room.

  • humidity (float) – In case of a VR51 is inside the room, you can get humidity through the API.

MAX_TARGET_TEMP = 30.0¶

Max target temperature that can be apply to a room.

MIN_TARGET_TEMP = 5.0¶

Min target temperature that can be apply to a room.

MODES = [OperatingMode(name='OFF'), OperatingMode(name='MANUAL'), OperatingMode(name='AUTO'), OperatingMode(name='QUICK_VETO')]¶

List of mode that are applicable to rooms component.

Zone¶

class pymultimatic.model.component.Zone(id: str, name: Optional[str], time_program: pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimeProgram, current_temperature: Optional[float], target_temperature: Optional[float], operating_mode: pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode, quick_veto: Optional[pymultimatic.model.mode.QuickVeto], target_min_temperature: float, active_function: str, rbr: bool)¶

This is representing a zone from the system.

Note

If rbr (Room By Room) is True, the zone itself doesn’t mean anything anymore, it means rooms are ‘controlling’ the zone.

Parameters

  • target_min_temperature (float) – This is the set back temperature, so if the temperature goes below that value, the zone should heat.

  • active_function (str) – Indicate what the zone is doing (basically ‘HEATING’ or ‘STANDBY’).

  • rbr (bool) – Room By Room, means the zone is controlled by ambisense.

MAX_TARGET_TEMP = 30.0¶

Max temperature that can be apply to a zone.

MIN_TARGET_TEMP = 5.0¶

Min temperature that can be apply to a zone.

MODES = [OperatingMode(name='AUTO'), OperatingMode(name='OFF'), OperatingMode(name='DAY'), OperatingMode(name='NIGHT'), OperatingMode(name='QUICK_VETO')]¶

List of mode that are applicable to zones component.

Device¶

class pymultimatic.model.component.Device(name: str, sgtin: str, device_type: str, battery_low: bool, radio_out_of_reach: bool)¶

This is a physical device inside a Room. It can be a VR50 VR51 or VR52.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of the device, this is set by the mobile app.

  • sgtin (str) – The is the serial number of the device.

  • device_type (str) – Device type (VR51 = ‘VALVE’).

  • battery_low (bool) – Indicate if the device is running low battery.

  • radio_out_of_reach (bool) – Indicate if the device is connected to the system.

System¶

class pymultimatic.model.system.System(holiday_mode: pymultimatic.model.mode.HolidayMode, system_status: pymultimatic.model.status.SystemStatus, boiler_status: Optional[pymultimatic.model.status.BoilerStatus], zones: List[pymultimatic.model.component.Zone], rooms: List[pymultimatic.model.component.Room], hot_water: Optional[pymultimatic.model.component.HotWater], circulation: Optional[pymultimatic.model.component.Circulation], outdoor_temperature: Optional[float], quick_mode: Optional[pymultimatic.model.mode.QuickMode], errors: List[pymultimatic.model.status.Error], boiler_info: Optional[pymultimatic.model.info.BoilerInfo], system_info: pymultimatic.model.info.SystemInfo)¶

This class represents the main class to manipulate vaillant system. It groups all the information about the system.

Parameters

  • holiday_mode (HolidayMode) – Holiday mode.

  • system_status (SystemStatus) – Status of the system.

  • boiler_status (BoilerStatus) – Status of the boiler.

  • zones (List[Zone]) – List of zone.

  • rooms (List[Room]) – List of room.

  • hot_water (HotWater) – If hot water is present, it’s available here.

  • circulation (Circulation) – If circulation is present, it’s available here.

  • outdoor_temperature (float) – Outdoor temperature

  • quick_mode (QuickMode) – If any quick mode is running, it’s available here.

  • errors (List[Error]) – If there are errors, you can find them here.

  • boiler_info (BoilerInfo) – Information (pressure, temperature) about the boiler.

  • system_info (SystemInfo) – Information about the system.

get_active_mode_circulation(circulation: Optional[pymultimatic.model.component.Circulation] = None) → Optional[pymultimatic.model.mode.ActiveMode]¶

Get the current ActiveMode for a Circulation. This is the only way to get the real one.

Parameters

  • circulation (Circulation) – The circulation you want the active mode

  • If None is passed, it will pick up the circulation from (for.) –

  • system. (the) –

Returns

The active mode.

Return type

ActiveMode

  • If None is passed, it will pick up the hot water from the (for.) –

  • system. –
